column2: able to understand, or showing that you understand, what a situation or person is really like 领悟力强的；富有洞察力的
column3: e.g. We are always looking for more interesting and [[insightful]] ideas to share with our readers.

column2: [U, sing.] a balance between different people, groups, or forces that compete with each other, so that none is stronger than the others and the situation is not likely to change suddenly 平衡；均衡；均势
column3: e.g. The point at which the solid and the liquid are in [[equilibrium]] is called the freezing point.

column2: completely and only 完全地；纯粹地；仅仅
column3: e.g. The management committee decided to close the museum [[purely]] because it cost too much to run.

column2: [C] a situation in which it is very difficult to decide what to do, because all the choices seem equally good or equally bad 进退两难的境地；困境
column3: e.g. The [[dilemma]] over human cloning lies at the heart of the ethical choices facing society.

column2: very good, enjoyable, or unusual, and worth remembering 难忘的；值得纪念的
column3: e.g. If you want to catch and save this [[memorable]] event in your life, bring your camera with you.

column2: widely accepted and used for a long time; traditional in style or idea 经典的；古典的；传统的
column3: e.g. Adam Smith is considered one of the founders of [[classical]] economics.

column2: (only before noun) shared or made by every member of a group or society 集体的；共同的；共有的
column3: e.g. I think it's our [[collective]] responsibility to create an environment for future generations to be even more successful.

column2: [U] health and happiness 幸福；健康；福祉
column3: e.g. Biological scientists have to consider the balance between human health and animal [[welfare]] as they push forward the frontiers of research.

column2: [C, U] a story, painting, etc. in which the events and characters represent ideas or teach a moral lesson 寓言；讽刺
column3: e.g. The book is a kind of [[allegory]] of Latin American history.

column2: impossible to see 看不见的；不可见的
column3: e.g. This sophisticated technology allows scientists to find things that are [[invisible]] to the naked eye.

column2: very bad, or ending in failure 灾难性的；以失败告终的
column3: e.g. In some cases, lowering interest rates could have [[disastrous]] consequences for the economy.

column2: [C] sb. who goes into houses, shops, etc. to steal things 入室窃贼
column3: e.g. A number of [[burglars]] broke into the gallery and stole dozens of priceless paintings.

column2: say that you believe sb. is guilty of a crime or of doing sth. bad 控告；指控；指责
column3: e.g. No one could ever [[accuse]] this government of not caring about the poor.

column2: [C, U] the crime of stealing money or things from a bank, shop, etc., esp. using violence 抢劫
column3: e.g. The gang (犯罪团伙) admitted they had committed four recent bank [[robberies]].

column2: admit, esp. to the police, that you have done sth. wrong or illegal （尤指向警方）坦白，招认，招供
column3: e.g. Gabriele [[confessed]] to leaking copies of the documents to the press because he wanted to expose the "evil and corruption" in the company.

column2: (fml.) the best or most suitable 最佳的；最适宜的
column3: e.g. They insist their business idea is [[optimal]] and will be wildly acceptable to customers.

column2: being in a better situation, if or after sth. happens 更好的
column3: e.g. You'd be [[better]] off living on your own than quarreling all the time with your dad.

column2: [C] sth. that has the same value, purpose, job, etc. as sth. else 同等物；等价物；对应物
column3: e.g. Is there a French word that is the exact [[equivalent]] of the English word "home"?

column2: measured or judged by how similar or different it is to sth. else; relative 比较而言的；相对的
column3: e.g. After living in poverty for most of his lifetime, he spent his last few years in [[comparative]] comfort.

column2: send out gas, heat, light, sound, etc. 散发，发出（气、热、光、声音等）
column3: e.g. The machine will [[emit]] a noisy sound when you press the red button.

column2: [U] the fact that sb. is not doing anything （人）无行动，没反应
column3: e.g. The city council was accused of [[inaction]] on the parking problem of the city.

column2: [C] (curriculum vitae) a short written document that lists your education and previous jobs, which you send to employers when you are looking for a job 简历；履历
column3: e.g. Applicants interested in applying for the position should submit their [[CVs]] no later than February 15.

column2: involve sth. as a necessary part or result 使必要；需要
column3: e.g. The job of a dance teacher [[entails]] teaching students the technique and performance of dance movements.

column2: [C, U] the fact of not using time, money, energy, etc. in the best way 低效率
column3: e.g. The conflict between management and workers makes for [[inefficiency]] in the workplace.

column2: become involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens 干预；介入；插手
column3: e.g. I don't usually like to [[intervene]] in disputes between husbands and wives.

column2: [C, U] the act of becoming involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens 干涉；干预；介入
column3: e.g. Repeated [[interventions]] on the currency markets have failed to prevent the value of the currency falling.

column2: that must be obeyed because it is accepted in law 有法律约束力的；必须遵守的
column3: e.g. Participants in the world trade talks have agreed to negotiate specific [[binding]] commitments.

column2: [C, U] sth. that encourages you to work harder, start a new activity, etc. 刺激；动力；鼓励
column3: e.g. There is little [[incentive]] for people to leave their cars at home when public transport remains so expensive.

column2: accept that sth. is true or exists, esp. when you are developing an idea or argument 认为某事理所当然如此；认为某事是想当然（尤用于得出观点）
column3: e.g. The fact that people find change difficult is taken as a given.

column2: be involved in a plan, deal, etc. 卷入；参与
column3: e.g. We need some financial advice — that's where Kate [[comes]] in.

column2: [U] the state of being an entrepreneur, or the activities or spirit associated with being an entrepreneur 企业家身份；企业家行为或精神
column3: e.g. Individuals not only need to examine their personal finances but also the considerable lifestyle changes [[entrepreneurship]] can bring.

column2: [C] a new business activity that involves taking risks 风险项目；风险投资；冒险事业
column3: e.g. Another idea that has attracted [[venture]] capitalists' interest is online learning.

column2: [C] general attitude to life and the world （对生活和世界的）看法，观点，态度
column3: e.g. You will become more mature as your [[outlook]] on life is influenced by the books that you read.

column2: [U, sing.] the desire to know about sth. 好奇心
column3: e.g. In my view, intellectual [[curiosity]] is a sufficient reason for this new scientific endeavor.

column2: 1) work hard to develop a particular skill, attitude, or quality 培养，养成（技能、态度或素质）
column3: e.g. [[Cultivating]] a positive mental attitude toward yourself can reap tremendous benefits.；e.g. Near the coast, huge areas of land are given over to [[cultivating]] tomatoes.

column2: 2) prepare and use land for growing crops and plants 耕；耕作
column3: e.g. [[Cultivating]] a positive mental attitude toward yourself can reap tremendous benefits.；e.g. Near the coast, huge areas of land are given over to [[cultivating]] tomatoes.

column2: considering a person or thing as a whole, rather than as separate parts 整体（论）的；全面的
column3: e.g. Policymakers need to take a long-term, [[holistic]] approach to the housing finance reform.

column2: [U] the quality of being successful and working in the way that was intended 有效性
column3: e.g. There are doubts about the [[effectiveness]] of the new drug in treating the disease.

column2: not involving anything or anyone else 唯一地；仅仅；独一无二地
column3: e.g. Too often we make buying decisions based [[solely]] upon what we see in advertisements.

column2: [U] when a business or an activity makes a profit, or the amount of profit it makes 获利；盈利；利润
column3: e.g. Competition between firms will continue to force those prices down, which will undermine the [[profitability]] of the industry.

column2: supporting or based on the principles of capitalism 资本主义的
column3: e.g. In a [[capitalistic]] society, individuals with wealth and privilege have much of the power.

column2: (only before noun) introducing new and better methods or ideas for the first time 开创性的；先驱的；探索性的
column3: e.g. Cowley's [[pioneering]] development of modern emergency medicine helped save countless lives.

column2: improve the way that sth. is done or used so that it is as effective as possible 使最优化；使尽可能完善；使尽量有效
column3: e.g. Doctors are concentrating on understanding the disease better, and on [[optimizing]] the treatment.

column2: [C] a company, organization, or business 公司；组织；企业
column3: e.g. To a great many individuals setting up a new business [[enterprise]], the last thing they usually bother about is accounting and tax.

column2: pleasing and satisfying 令人高兴的；令人满意的
column3: e.g. It must be very [[gratifying]] to see all your children grown-up and happy.

column2: [U] the quality of being able to continue for a long time 可持续性
column3: e.g. "Do you want environmental [[sustainability]] or do you want economic advantage?" asked McConnell.

column2: move, drive, or push sth. forward 推动；推进；驱动
column3: e.g. The rocket is attached to the spacecraft and is designed to [[propel]] it toward Mars.

column2: completely new and different, esp. in a way that leads to great improvements 革命性的；突破性的；创新的
column3: e.g. The 20th century brought about [[revolutionary]] changes in our lifestyles.

column2: [U, sing.] the importance of an event, action, etc., esp. because of the effect or influence it will have in the future 重要性，意义（尤指对将来的影响）
column3: e.g. The discovery of the new drug is of great [[significance]] for people suffering from heart problems.

column2: [C] (the ~) the part of business activity that is concerned with buying and selling goods in competition with other companies 市场（指涉及营销的种种活动）
column3: e.g. Some retailers worry that new regulations will hurt their ability to compete in the [[marketplace]].

column2: 1) a strong permanent influence on sb. / sth. 强大而持久的影响
column3: e.g. Gandhi was a tremendously brave man whose unique form of courage left a lasting [[imprint]] on India's history.；e.g. She could clearly see the [[imprint]] of her fingers on his pale wrist.

column2: 2) the mark left by an object being pressed into or onto sth. 印记；压痕
column3: e.g. Gandhi was a tremendously brave man whose unique form of courage left a lasting [[imprint]] on India's history.；e.g. She could clearly see the [[imprint]] of her fingers on his pale wrist.

column2: feeling sympathy for people who are suffering 充满同情心的；怜悯的
column3: e.g. The public's response to the crisis was generous and [[compassionate]].

column2: [C] sth. that sb. has achieved that continues to exist after they stop working or die （某人不再工作或去世后）留下的成果
column3: e.g. Perhaps her most important [[legacy]] was her program of educational reform.

column2: [U] a sensible and careful attitude that makes you avoid unnecessary risks 明智谨慎；慎重；审慎
column3: e.g. Businessmen are showing remarkable [[prudence]] in investing in the region.

column2: finally, after everything else has been done or considered 最后；最终
column3: e.g. Everything will [[ultimately]] depend on what is said at the meeting with the directors next week.

column2: if a fact, event, etc. implies sth., it shows that it is likely to be true 意味着（某事可能是真的）
column3: e.g. These findings do not [[imply]] that urbanization makes little or no difference to the small towns.

column2: involving a combination of social and economic factors 社会经济的
column3: e.g. The age, education, and [[socioeconomic]] status of these young mothers led to less satisfactory childcare.

column2: understand sth. that is complicated or difficult 理解，领悟（复杂或困难的事物）
column3: e.g. In an effort to [[comprehend]] the principles of investment of any sort, you have to know the way to determine the return on investment.

column2: extremely large 巨大的；极大的
column3: e.g. Regular visits from a social worker can be of [[immense]] value to elderly people living alone.

column2: 1) (fml.) have a particular quality or ability 拥有，具有（某品质或能力）
column3: e.g. I'm afraid he doesn't [[possess]] a sense of humor.；e.g. Because of his gambling, he lost everything he [[possessed]].

column2: 2) (fml.) have or own sth. 拥有，持有（某物）
column3: e.g. I'm afraid he doesn't [[possess]] a sense of humor.；e.g. Because of his gambling, he lost everything he [[possessed]].

column2: (fml.) ask for sth. in an emotional way 恳求；乞求；哀求
column3: e.g. If you feel depressed for more than three weeks, I [[implore]] you to seek professional help.

column2: completely change the way people do sth. or think about sth. 使彻底变革；给···带来革命
column3: e.g. The company [[revolutionized]] the market for watches with its inexpensive watches aimed at the youth market.

column2: (the ~) (fml.) the second of two people or things just mentioned （刚提及的两个人或物中的）后者
column3: e.g. Where unemployment and crime are high, it can be assumed that the [[latter]] is due to the former.

column2: developing well and being successful 繁荣的；兴旺的；成功的
column3: e.g. A stable and [[flourishing]] economy is essential for political stability and national security, and vice versa.

column2: unwilling to change ideas or behavior 顽固的；僵化的
column3: e.g. We were disappointed that they insisted on such a [[rigid]] interpretation of the rules.

column2: (usu. before noun) very careful and thorough 小心的；费尽心思的；精心的
column3: e.g. It is the kind of [[painstaking]] work that only someone who knows every inch of the ship could perform.

column2: [C, U] quality, ability, or achievement that is average or below average 普通；平庸；平常
column3: e.g. We will not accept [[mediocrity]]; the job they do is of critical importance.

column2: 1) (~ to sb. / sth.) strange and frightening; different from what you are used to 陌生的；不熟悉的
column3: e.g. In a world that had suddenly become [[alien]] and dangerous, Michael was her only security.；e.g. In short, he concluded that the canals were artificial constructs of technologically advanced [[alien]] beings.

column2: 2) connected with creatures from another world 外星的
column3: e.g. In a world that had suddenly become [[alien]] and dangerous, Michael was her only security.；e.g. In short, he concluded that the canals were artificial constructs of technologically advanced [[alien]] beings.

column2: find out about sth. that has been kept secret 发现；揭露
column3: e.g. The investigation [[uncovered]] evidence of a large-scale illegal trade in wild birds.

column2: very important or serious, esp. because there may be important results 关键的；重大的；重要的
column3: e.g. Whether or not to move overseas is a [[momentous]] decision for the family.

column2: be caused by sth. or start from sth. 由···引起
column3: e.g. His grief sprang from the loss of the most important love he had ever known in his life.

column2: show clearly that sth. happened or exists 表明；说明
column3: e.g. Her skin spoke of warm summer days spent in the sun.

column2: do or discover sth. new 开辟新天地；创新
column3: e.g. Inventing such a camera wouldn't be easy, but Cameron said he was ready to break new ground.
